body:
Comment 7: 
Marking "Working as intended".

The "go tool" command should look in the tool directory, nowhere else. It should
certainly not scan $GOPATH looking for likely candidates, as that is sure to find
obsolete binaries that cause confusing behavior or worse.

I firmly believe this is a non-issue. For those using binary distributions, the tools
are installed and this will simply not arise. Moreover, such people will not be
installing individual tools just to have the latest version. That is not how binary
distributions are used.

For those working from source, who are fewer in number, the situation is easy to
understand. Yes, it may cause the occasional confusing moment but that doesn't warrant
changing the way installation works, which is focused (for these tools) on the canonical
setup of a binary distribution.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
